title: Use native-tls stuff when making clients and requests.

body: Ran into this issue with `http::send_files` a few days ago, but found out that the problem was also in `http::get_messages`. I decided to just change all occurrences that I could find.

title: Change from #[doc(hidden)] to pub(crate)
body: The only exception i made was to `src/voice/error.rs`, as all of the cases of an enum are _always_ public; but the actual enum can or can't be public.

title: Add cache docs
body:
Includes everything but the module level docs because I don't know what to do for that.

- [x] Cache
  - [x] guild
  - [x] group
  - [x] private_channel
  - [x] role
  - [x] user

I'm open to changes. Particularly, I'm not sure if the method I'm using is idiomatic, but it's how I usually do things. I'm not sure if there's a neater way to use stuff like `and_then`.

title: Don't show a group in help if there are no commands to show.

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body:
This will prevent stuff like the following:

> **Group**: `ping`, `pong`
> **Other**: _[No Commands]_
> **Ungrouped**: `help`

If no commands are found, it will simply drop the group like so: 

> **Group**: `ping`, `pong`
> **Ungrouped**: `help`

title: Add Content for MessageBuilder
body:
This adds a new Content type which `push`, `push_safe`, `push_line`, and `push_line_safe` have been modified to take. This allows for flexible formatting without the duplicated `push_mono`, `push_bold_italic` etc.

```rs
let message_content = MessageBuilder::new()
  .push(Bold + Italic + Code + "text")
  .build()

assert_eq!(message_content, "***`text`***")
```

This should be fairly flexible, and makes sure to apply formatting in the correct order regardless of which order the modifiers are provided. Provides coercions for `&str` and `String`

title: Add _line and _line_safe variants to MessageBuilder
body: Tested it with every variant without an explicit newline and it worked well. They all utilize the older methods to do the actual formatting, so it should be correct.

body:
Tested both with_embeds and plain and they seem to work. Let me know if something needs to be changed or reworked.

On a side note, I thought about manually moving the "Ungrouped" section to be the last in the list but am not sure if this would be desired behavior.

title: Fix call to VoiceManager.join in examples/06_voice

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body:
`VoiceManager.join(&mut self, guild_id: Option<GuildId>, ...)`
has been changed to
`VoiceManager.join<G>(&mut self, guild_id: G, ...) where G: Into<GuildId>`.
 
We should no longer wrap `guild_id` with `Some`.

title: Allow unreachable code in command! macro due to return on all paths

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

title: Add support for retrieving invites with counts
body:
Previously retrieving an invite with the `?with_counts=true` wasn't possible.

Added support to `get_invite` for retrieving an invite with the counts, this requires the user to pass true to the function.
The counts include `approximate_presence_count` and `approximate_member_count` which have been added to the `Invite` stuct.

Done in response to: https://github.com/zeyla/serenity/issues/83

title: Remove deprecated login_bot function from README

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

title: Don't skip everyone role when checking channel overwrites.

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body: I came across this issue while trying to check permissions using `permissions_for`. I found out that if I made the **everyone** role disable attaching images, my bot would still attempt to attach them even with the check. This seemed to be because `permissions_for` skips the **everyone** role explicitly. All this PR does is make it check that role as well.

title: Added the faded_purple colour
body: `faded_purple` was added as a colour and the typo in `meibe_pink` being `meibi_pink` has been corrected.
